So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a contraceptive if you do not have one? Choices:  A: health center B: vagina C: emergency room D: drawer E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### The given statement(s) below:<n>```<n>- This is a trick question. You can insert yourself in the question since most people cannot have a contraceptive in their vagina.<n>```<n>### Rationale:<n>```<n>- To choose the health center, vagina and to be a little bit creative to get a contraceptive, we can choose the option A & D. <n>- But if we are not inserted as a subject in the question, the statement will be like this: <n>- 'You' would get the contraceptive 'if' you do not 'have one.' Hence, we can choose option B & E<n>- We can also choose option C (emergency room) if we insert ourself in the question, this statement will be a bit tricky: if you do not have a contraceptive, where will you 'get' one??? (in your vaginia???)<n>- So the answer will be B & D<n>```<n>### Answer:<n>```<n>- I can get the contraceptive at the health center<n>```<n>### Solution:<n>It is necessary to know the subject because we are asked where should we get a contraceptive. If we are the subject, we use the pronouns: I, me, mine, my. For example: I can get the contraception from emergency room and health center.<n>If we are not used as the subject, the pronouns used will be: <n><n>### If you could, where would you store some money that you are not using?<n><n>``` <n>- If I am 'you' then I can store some money at the health center<n>- It is possible to store money using a drawer<n>- For some people, the drawer is not only for money but it can also be used as storage space for some other things<n>- If you ask: where would you store some not in circulation cash? this answer will be 'inside my pockets'<n>- I can also use vagina as a storage place<n>- It is easier (for many people) to store some money inside your hand. They can use their own hand<n>```<n>### If the only thing the dog brought was a chew toy, then who might the dog be?<n><n>```<n>- The dog will not be the same type of person asked<n>```<n><n>### If a

Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:After going for run you have a sense of what? People do not repeat actions 150 times in a day. <n>3. The number 150 is not the minimum or maximum amount of things that a person can do in a day.<n>4. People do not do 80 things that are repetitions.<n>5. Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		Suicide is the action of killing yourself deliberately. So, to answer the question, we need to understand why someone would kill him or herself deliberately. <n>### Choices:  A) suffering - could be a possible answer, but can be argued as suicide is more an emotional act than a physical one <n>### B) he was happy - doesn't support the hypothesis of the question.  It can be argued suicide has very little to do with the emotional state of a person. <n>### C) avoid problems - can be a valid reason, but it doesn't seem like it would prompt a deliberate suicide<n>### D) unhappy - is an inaccurate explanation of why someone would kill themself deliberately, however suicide could be a way of seeking relief from unhappiness. <n>### E) end pain - this option seems to fit, so we can choose that one.<n><n>Answer: E: end pain<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Where can the legs of a stool be built? Choices:  A: jail B: internet cafe C: blacksmith's shop D: building E: bar<n><n>### Response:		The legs could be built in any one of the places listed. However, the choice is made in the context of what is being built: a stool. If the question was about where to build a table, the answer would differ.<n><n>### Explanation:The choice of a stool as the object of construction implies that a person is constructing the legs, not building the stool. Therefore, the location of the building would not affect the actual construction.<n><n>### Input 2:The sun has reached the end of the day. Which of the following does the sun also make? Choices: 1: The answer is D 2: I 3: C 4: B 5: A<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>### Expected answer 2:<n><n><n>### Input3:If someone is a "spare" when they are in a place where people play a board game, then the person doesn't want to play the game.<n><n>### Response3:To play a game, a person must want to play. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1. In order to understand where to go next with this assignment, it can be helpful to break down the question:<n><n>When a student<n> <n> Is attempting<n>to do something  <n>In a particular way  <n>Suggests/indicates/relates to  <n>Something else...<n><n>2. In this case, the students are studying together ("asking questions") which is not their primary goal. The student's primary goal is something they are hoping to "further". It is not clear what the student is asking questions about so that's why it's indicated with "study" and there is nothing after it. I'm unsure what the next word should be.  <n>Further study?   <n>Studying further?       <n>3. To complete these steps it is important to ask for assistance. If you have questions don't hesitate to reach out.<n><n>### Input<n>In what situation are you not able to talk to another person? Choices:  a) talking by phone b) talking in private c) talking around others d) none of these e) only public places<n><n>### Response<n><n>1. With the question like this an important thing to remember is that the choice that best fits is the one that applies to the most situations. If I only have one person to speak to at a funeral, I might be speaking to them one on one and I would not be talking to two people, so this is a choice that doesn't quite fit and should not be chosen.<n>2. To get started, answer the following:  Which one of your options doesn't fit well? (this is in private and that one is around others). That's the right answer. Now let's focus on the rest.<n><n>| Choice | Examples |<n>|---|---|<n>| a) talking by phone| When talking on the phone in public|<n>| b) talking in private| When I'm home alone|<n>| c) talking around others| When I'm talking to coworkers in the break room|<n>| d) only public places| When talking at a funeral|<n>e) none of these| I can talk to people at work, at the grocery store, in public places, at a restaurant, etc., so there are no restrictions on my speaking|<n><n>3. Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Where would you find some swords in your house? Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n><n>### Response:		Answers: 1. A: modern house 2. B: building 3. C: townhouse 4. D: neighbor's and downtown house<n><n>### Response Reasoning: 1. Light sensors and automatic doors are features often seen in modern housing, so a modern house is likely in the mix of the possible houses.<n><n>2. While "building" can mean different things depending on the sentence in which it is used, it tends to refer to anything large or commercial. Since this house is more of a residence, "building" is more likely referring to something similar to a house.<n>3. "Townhouse" is not the answer, even if in the literal sense, because a townhouse, by definition, is not detached from a structure. In this case, the house could be detached, in which case it may or may not be a townhouse.<n>4. A neighbor's house is not the answer as neighbors can live in any house. And while "downtown" can refer to a particular part of a city, it is not referring to a specific building, but rather a group of businesses and residences. So, none of the remaining options are specific enough for us to know which one the garage was referring to.<n><n>Answer: 1. A. Modern House 2. B. Building 3. C. Townhouse 4. D. Neighbor's and Downtown House <n><n>### Instructions: Answer the multiple choice question below.<n><n>### How to Answer: Carefully read each question. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:John was stuck in his house.  He couldn't get out the door.  He was very frightened when the smoke detectors went off, but luckily it was a false alarm.  Why might he be stuck? Choices:  A: fire B: belong to C: winter storm D: face south E: burn down<n><n>### Response:		<n>Incorrect answer choices are:<n>* A: fire<n>* C: winter storm<n><n>### Correct answer choices are:<n><n>Answer: A: own home<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>**Answer the following multiple choice questions.**<n><n>Input: I was at the park.  What time was I there?   Choices:  A. 6:08 or 6:38 B. 6:13 or 6:23 C. 6:15 or 6:22 D. 6:33 or 6:43 E. 6:46 or 6:56<n><n>Rationales: The time mentioned above is 6:37.  If I want to know what time I went to the park, the choice of options I can choose will be between `6:13 or6:23`,which corresponds to being at the park between 6:13 to 6:23.<n>### Response<n><n>You are at the park at 6:46.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: Which of the following is true on Saturday?  Choices:  A.: I have to work B.: I have to cook C.: I have to mow D.: I have to bathe<n><n>### Response<n>Correct answer choices are:<n>- A. I have to work (on Saturday)<n><n>### Instrumentation:<n><n>#### Input:<n><b>Who is more likely to eat out of the house? (select one)</b><n>A: A woman of 25<n>B: A man or 26<n><n><b>Who does not have more kids? (select one) </b><n>C: Woman of 25<n>S: Man of 26<n><n>#### Output:<n><b>Answer to question one: </b><n>A: B <b><br>Answer to question two: </b><n>C : B <b><br><br>Answer to both questions: </b><n>B: Woman of 26.<n><n>#### Input:<br>The people who love me the most are my husband, my parents, and my daughter.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:The lady was getting worked up about the article explaining the uptick in accidents in their area, but her husband was dismissive of it stating that accidents what? Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* If she was getting worked up, she was clearly feeling emotional about it. <n>* Dismissive (incorrect) means "to ignore or refuse to acknowledge the importance of something" or "to treat as unimportant".<n>* B doesn't make grammatical sense<n>* If he told that accidents happen anytime, it isn't being dismissive. <n>* E doesn't make any grammatical sense: "anywhere" would imply anywhere on the earth, not anytime. <n>* If he said accidents happen often, then that is being dismissive of her argument. However, we can't state whether he did or not because the article would have included details about their area. <n>* Therefore, "accidents happen often" doesn't make sense in this case, which leaves us with "A: hurt people" being the most logical answer as "D: happen often" and "E: happen anywhere" are obviously out of the running and "A: happen anytime" would be ungrammatical.<n><n>Answer: A: hurt people

Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:The gambler had been winning a lot, he wisely decided to what? Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		<n>1) D: return<n>2) A: matchwinning<n><n>### Demotion:<n>Rationales:<n>1.  The gambler won a lot, so he wisely decided to match their winnings.<n>2. This means that he would match his winnings by betting the original amount of money won. This is more appropriate than D: returning (although this may be an equally acceptable option), as matching implies exchanging identical amounts. <n>3. The gambler would not want to celebrate their winnings as this may indicate an increase in betting. This is an undesirable outcome when wanting to limit their risk by matchwinning. This is an undue waste of time, as the gambler should be concentrating on the next set of bets. Finally, the gambler shouldn't return (E) because this does not directly relate to the situation.<n>4. These rationales combined eliminate all options except for D: matchwinning, as the rationale for B: cash in is too vague and the rationale for E: celebrate isn't relevant.<n>5.<n>Answer: D matchwinning<n><n>Input: The teacher said she had never had what so she can't do it. Choices:  A. homework B. sleeping C. a baby D. more classes E. a pet<n><n>### Demonic:<n>Rationales to choose C: a baby is the answer:<n>1. No teacher can have a baby. <n>2. So, when the teacher has never had a baby, she can't say she might give one. <n>3. Thus, "can't do it" in the question means can't say she could do it. <n>4. Therefore, C a baby is the answer.<n>    <n>### Input: Your son wants to know what his mother does at night. What does he ask her?<n>    <n>### Demon:<n>Rationales :<n>1. Since the son wants to know what mother does at night, he asks her: What does she do at night? <n>2. The sentence is not the opposite like the given choice. <n>3.<n>**Answer:** C: What does she do in the evening?<n><n>Input: In some instances it is the duty of someone to tell them what they don't know. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:What treatment might an old time doctor have tried to accomplish with leeches? Choices:  A: heart transplant B: distance himself C: perform surgery D: study medicine E: let blood<n><n>### Response:		<n>Leeches used to be used as a medical treatment, and were known to aid in treating illnesses and diseases by consuming a "vital substance" from the patient's blood.<n>They could not replace organs or perform complex surgeries, therefore they would not have done A: heart transplant.<n>The doctors of the time didn't have the knowledge or resources to practice medicine, so they would not have studied medicine as it requires education; they would do D: let blood instead. <n><n>### Input : You have the option of buying a new car by cash or on a loan? Choices: <n>A: Cash<n>B: Loan<n>C: Car Loan<n>D: Credit Loan<n><n>### Response : A car loan and a credit loan are both forms of taking out a loan to finance a car. If they were thirsty, the person could use a glass of water.<n><n>### Response B<n>A: If they are thirsty, they can drink a glass of water. <n>B: They are not thirsty as they are currently not wet from a shower.<n>C: The only way the person could possibly not have a car loan option if they do not have cash. They would also need to have a credit loan option.<n>D: If the person is thirsty their entire body is wet.<n>E: The person could use a sink to turn the water on or off.<n><n>### Demo<n><n>### A: If the person has drunk an empty glass of water, they would not be able to quench their thirst using only a glass of water.  <n><n>A<n>1. Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to do when listening to an expert speak? Choices:  A: learning B: fatigue C: mercy D: empathy E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>When listening to an expert speak, you hope you will be able to learn from what they have to offer. However, not all experts are good speakers, and you might be hoping to avoid feeling fatigue or anxiety instead.<n><n>### Input<n>What kind of things are we not trying to do with water? Choices: A: taste it B: spit it out C: drink it D: fill up containers E: drown<n><n>### Response<n>We are not trying to do:<n><n>- Taste it (A), that's why we are not drinking it!<n>- Fill up containers (E), maybe we are using water to make containers, but then the containers have water in them.<n>- Drink it or drown or fill it for it to be water.<n><n>### You hope your water is:<n><n>Because water is a thing we eat, drink, and use, we hope the water we use is free from contamination.<n>![Water Testing](/resources/testWater.jpg)<n><n>There will likely be a lot of tests that come as time goes on, to make sure the water we consume is clean.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. In terms of meals made, in which position would the computer programmer stand on average?  Choices:  A:(1st) B:(2nd) C:(3rd) D: (4th)<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The computer programmer is most likely to be responsible for making a meal for each person in the household, because this is the most specialized role that each person takes. <n>The accountant provides an important service by managing the household budget.  However this doesn't necessarily provide the household with a meal.  The baker prepares some of the specialized meals in the household, so their contribution is not as important as the programmer's.  Additionally the baker receives most or only some of the meals they made, which may make it difficult to measure how many meals they really provided.  Finally the computer programmer has a higher skill level than the average member of their profession, and would therefore need to make fewer meals than a computer programmer of average ability. <n>Therefore the correct answer is B:(3rd); the programmer contributes meals at their specialist skill level, provides value for their contribution, and then receives some other meals in return.<n><n>### Answer:B:(3rd)<n><n>### The correct answers are:<n>1. oil refineries<n>2. in books<n>3. (3rd)

Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:James didn't know what to do.  He felt that he'd ruin his relationship with Jen if he took it further, and he didn't want to do that.  At the same time,  He fight that pushing farther might do what to something good? Choices:  A: found B: destroy C: construct D: fix E: produce<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Rationales:<n>1. Jen is an individual.<n>2. James doesn't want to ruin his relationship with ___ by taking it further.<n>3. His goal is to construct a positive outcome by pursuing ____.<n>4. This is not the same as destroying ___.<n>5. This is not the opposite of ___.<n>6. This is not the definition of destroying ___.<n>7. This is not the goal of ___.<n>8. This is more specific than what ___ can do.<n>9. The opposite of constructing ___ is to do the opposite and destroy ___.<n>10. Constructing is a verb.<n>11. One ___ that would be opposite to constructing ___ is taking it further.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		<n>Band, orchestra, jazz band, rock band are all musical groups that perform music together, and so it is most likely that a musician would perform a concerto (a full-length solo concert) most likely with one of these groups. On the other hand, a music store would not be likely a place where a concerto is performed, because they are mostly for selling instruments and music, and not primarily a place for performances.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>1. A musician is most likely perform a concerto with an orchestra or band. A music store would not be an appropriate place as they typically sell instruments and music, and have performances from solo artists. A clarinet concerto is a full- length solo concert so orchestra would be the preferred choice.

Choices:  A: middle east B: asia minor C: asia D: provide meat E: balkan peninsula<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Part a: Correct answer (A)<n>* Explanation:<n>### Explanation:<n><n>### ## Part b: Incorrect answer (E)<n>* Explanations:<n>```<n>I answered E - The name 'Balkan Peninsula' comes from  the Greek word Βαλκανικος (ball) and its Latin derivative balcanus which refers to the mountain chains of that region.[1] That etymology probably predates the use of the word as part of a proper noun.[2][3][4] The region, commonly known as the Balkans, consists of several eastern Alpine and Eastern Mediterranean countries: Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, Kosovo, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Romania, Serbia, and Slovenia, with the Black Sea on the east and the Adriatic Sea, Ionian Sea, and Aegean Sea on the south.<n>```<n><n>### Part a: The correct answer (A)<n><n>```<n>Turkey is situated in the middle part of the Asia minor. So, the correct answer is A is the correct answer.<n>```<n><n>The above are the results of the multiple choice quiz. They are therefore not listening to music since music requires effort which a person would not be able to give if they are working. They are not listening to music since they are tired.<n><n>### Input? Why aren't you listening to music? Choice: A: fall asleep<n><n>### Response?<n>I'm working<n><n>### Instruption:<n>1. Why not? Because my work is beginning<n>2. The answer is not valid because I am not accomplishing anything<n><n>### Input1.What has the student not accomplished? Choice: B: homework<n><n>### Response1<n>The student is beginning work. They cannot accomplish homework yet. They are not home working. So the answer is A: homework.<n><n>### Answer<n>B: homework<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:If people are vegetarian, what do they do more of? Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n><n>### Response:		<n>In their response, provide a complete sentence that properly completes the request above.<n><n>#### Your answer:<n>This solution requires Javascript to run the `code()` function. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: eat ice cream B: have sex C: sit down D: make mistakes E: hear sounds<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: make mistakes<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: The following question requires you to select all possible responses.<n>Which is a physical characteristic that can be used to describe both humans and dogs? Choices: head (A), tail (B), paw (C), eye (D), pear (E)<n>Rationales:<n>1. Humans and dogs both have heads.<n>2. Humans and dogs have tails.<n>3. Dogs have paws and paws can be used to describe humans.<n>4. Humans have eyes and dogs have eyes.<n>5. Humans have legs and dogs also have legs.<n>6. People don't grow pears, so it is not a physical characteristic.<n>7. People have eyes, so it's not a physical characteristic. It’s a sensory one. <n>8. No humans have tails unless they're specifically anatomically unusual, and therefore this is not a valid answer.<n>9. Therefore this is the correct answer: head, tail.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the most likely way you could become famous? Choices:<n>A: write a best selling novel<n>B: have a celebrity child<n>C: work as an actor<n>D: invent something that is used by a large number of people<n>E: create the next big thing in technology<n><n>### Response<n>D: invent something and it get used by a large number people.<n><n>### Logic<n>The question is asking about the most likely method for becoming famous, where "famous" is defined by being known by a large number of others. If you look at the responses (A, B, C, and E), they all involve people getting well known by a huge number of people. However, response (D) is the only one that involves creating something that will have a large number of users. Therefore response (D) is most logical.

Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>-<n>-<n>Rationales:<n><n><n><n><details><n><summary>A: tree tops</summary><n>- The monkey could either be in the canopies of the tree tops, or above the tree tops (in a tree, presumably) in which case, it's more difficult to say with certainty which one it is. However, there are trees, and then, there are canopies of trees. Tree tops would seem to be a natural habitat for monkeys. <n></details><n><n><details> <n><summary>B: rain forest</summary><n>- A rainforest is a specific geographical region of land that has certain climactic conditions that supports the presence of a great variety of flora and fauna. While a monkey could be living in a rainforest, it's difficult to call that the reason it's a place it's "likely to be" in the rainforest. This isn't enough to make any kind of definitive conclusion.<n></details><n><details><n>    <summary>C: zoological gardens </summary><n>- A zoo is a human construct that supports a diverse environment with species of all kinds, including that of primates. While a monkey likely would be in a rainforest in the wild, the chances of it being in a zoo are more than a little probable. <n></details><details><n><summary>(D) Great outdoors </summary><n>- Great outdoors implies that nature exists in some idealized, abstract form, which isn't the case. Humans are part of nature as well and monkeys are also part of the same ecosystem.<n></details><details><summary>(E) Zoos</summary><n>- Zoological gardens, or the zoological equivalent to wildlife preserves, are spaces where the native species exist, and the monkeys in these are likely to be as wild as monkeys in the natural rainforests. <n></details></details><n><n><n>### Answer: D<n><n><details> <summary>D) Great outdoos</summary><n></details>

The question asked about person-injuries which can be defined as the condition of suffering physical or mental harm as a result of an accident or injury (oxford dictionary). This information gives us enough information to eliminate choice B as person fatigue can not result in person injuries.<n>2. The question mentioned about fatigue so choice D: Tired can not be the answer as it can not result in person injury.<n>3. Choice C: Traffic Jam can not be the answer, as this is a byproduct of person-injury, not the reason that leads to person injury.<n>4. Choice A: Injuries can be understood as when a person loses strength due to injury, the consequence which is often by death. But the question also mentioned about accidents so choice A can not be the right answer.<n><n>5. Choice B: Fatigue is the correct answer as it is a consequence of person injuries.<n><n>Output: Person-Fatigue leads to person injuries which leads to traffic jams, the reason for traffic jams are person injuries. Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:The disease was spreading fast, so what were researchers desperately seeking? Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		When researchers are studying the spread of a disease, they are interested in the cause of the disease. This would involve investigating what makes diseases spread. The word "fast" in the prompt suggests that researchers are trying to understand the cause in time, and this is why they are looking for what causes the disease to spread quickly. The word "spot" in the prompt is most likely referring to the initial symptoms of a disease, such as a small rash or spot on a leaf. The cause spots on leaf is the correct answer because it is related to the researchers' motivation for studying the disease and provides additional context on why they are looking for the cause.<n><n>### Input : Who's job might require them to give directions? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the teams were evenly matched, then there would be mutual suspense. <n><n>This is a great example of using deductive reasoning. The spectators want to find the outcome of the competition, which makes A and E inappropriate choices. When the teams are evenly matched, there can just be one winner, not two (D & E), and they won't be envious or resentful of the competition (B & C). Therefore, "spectators wanted to find out the outcome of the competition" was the most appropriate answer<n><n>### Input::In order for a person to win a lot of money in the lotto, they must buy many lottery tickets.<n><n>### Response<n>### Instruction Response:<n>### You might write:<n>Therefore, if someone buys many lottery tickets and still does not win, then they will lose their money.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>This example has two different answers and so they should each be written.<n><n>### **Answer A:** <n>Therefore, one person wins big and everyone else loses their money.<n><n>By combining the concepts, the outcome in the question and the conclusion show that there can be only one winner in a game like the lottery, which is why everyone else will lose their buck if they don't get lucky.<n><n>### Answer B:<n>Therefore, because many people lose their money each week playing lotto without winning big,<n>their losses aren't as big as those who do.<n><n>The opposite is true if they were to lose all the money they put into betting on lotto. Lotto plays are similar to a risk, so for each person, there will not be an equal outcome between all losers and all winners in a lotto game.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>This is a good example of using inductive reasoning. The conclusion is correct, as it should be, but it could be confusing why other people have to lose their money for the winner to win. It may seem like they have to lose because they lose (A) but actually, they just lose because the other person won (B).<n><n>### Input :What does not an architect do? So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Nowadays people have smart ones, but at one time it was cutting edge to have a tiny calculator on your what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Where do you go to meet a friend who lives close to you? Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>Answer: C: table<n><n><n>### Input<n>A: A: apartment B-shelf C: pantry D: Table E: livingroom<n><n>### A response for the instructions<n>An apartment is a place where you would typically store dishes but not necessarily books, because in a typical household, books aren't commonly stored in the kitchen. The same reasoning would apply to other options. A shelf (E) could be an appropriate place to store books, but then it's not also where you typically store dishes. A living room (D) is a place to hang out, not necessarily somewhere you'd normally find dishes. Therefore, out of these options, a kitchen table (C) is the only choice where you would indeed have easy access to books and kitchen items. So, the answer would be C: table.<n><n>Answer:  The best choice in 1 is apartment - dishes in the fridge shelf or table are not places where you'd likely store books, but you could store books in the living room (D) or in the library (E) if you wanted to.<n>

Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The helm is not something  you wear on your head,  rather  it moves the masts. <n>Choices:  A:  sailing vessel  B:  paddleboat  C:  ship  D:1 motorboat E:2 tugboat<n>The correct answer is C: ship. This is because the helm is something with which a ship moves its masts. A ship has masts, and therefore the helm would be used to move its masts. A paddleboat isn't a ship, so that's not correct. A sailing vessel could be used both for sailing and for not moving the masts, so that's incorrect. A motorboat has motors instead of masts, so it doesn't use the helm at all. Tugboats use a tug, not a helm, and so they're also wrong. Therefore, the correct answer is C: the ship.<n><n>### Detailed Response:<n>**Instruction:The helm is a nautical term for the ship's steering mechanism, and so it has to do with what the ship does. <n>**Demonstration:<n>The correct answer is the ship because the helm moves the masts on a ship. <n>A ship is defined as a large floating vessel that carries people or material. <n>Therefore, a ship has masts and uses the nautical term 'helm' to move these masts.**<n><n>An important part of communication is the use of nonverbal communication. One such tool is voice-to-text. When you use voice-to-text on your smartphone, your device will interpret your words and turn them into text. Some types of text that are used in this technology include emoji symbols, icons, and abbreviations. For example, if you're texting with someone and you use an abbreviation that they don't know, they will think you are spelling something out! <n>The helm is not  something  wear on your head, rather  it moves the. These sentences represent a common type of voice-to-text error referred to as ‘homophone interference," as they are similar to one another. <n>The correct answer is A. A paddleboad is defined as a boat that is powered by a sail but can
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:John hated mosquitoes.  It wasn't the bloodsucking that he disliked, it was that the insects made what? Choices:  A: fly B: buzz C: move D: honey E: help flowers pollenate<n><n>### Response:		The insects help flowers pollinate.<n>

Choices:  The letter A: pots and pans.  B: towels.  C: food.  D: flowers.  E: umbrellas<n>Rationales: (Note: each option will be explained)<n><n>### Answer:The letter E: umbrellamakes the most sense as it contains both "outside" and "weather". The other answers do not. <n>If it was raining outside, you would generally bring an umbrella inside to prevent getting wet. Pots, pans, towels, food, and flowers wouldn't necessarily help.<n><n>#### Answer:C: food<n><n>Input: I asked you a question about 8 pants with holes but no shirts. What did you say? Choices: A: Yes B: Yes C: Maybe D: No E: Maybe<n>Rationales: If we go back to the definition, maybe means "not completely sure," and yes would be "completely sure". They both are used correctly in the question.<n>### Additional Information: The example here is the full example.<n>### Input:When I want, I can make my own food. Is the girl or apartment an issue with this? Choices: A is a girl. B is an apartment. C Apartment. D is a girl. E Apartment<n>A: Apartment doesn't answer the question, which is whether she has issues with the woman or the apartment she is renting.<n>B: The question asks whether apartment is the "issue" of making her own food. Having a girl around is not a problem, so option B is wrong.<n>C: This choice doesn't make sense because the other options are both people (apartment and girl), so this one must also be about a person.<n>D: Option E Apartment is wrong for the same reason as C.<n>Therefore, the correct answer is E: Apartment.<n>### Answer: Option E (apartment) is the correct answer because her problems would be with either the apartment or the girl<n><n>### Instructions: The instructions ask us what the main purpose of this paragraph is.

Choices:  A: direct traffic B: board vessels C: arm themselves D: help people E: find drugs<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer choice to identify officers of the law that only do certain things is D: Helping people.<n>All types of law enforcement, as identified in choices \E: Find Drugs\) and \Accompanying people\) are responsible for protecting people and their property, and their work can mean many different things depending on the specific job, but the work will always involve helping people (or protecting property if it is also a function) in some way.<n><n>### \(\therefore\), not all types of police do all things listed in choice \(A: DirectTraffic\), \(B: BoardVessels\), \(C: ArmMyself\), or \(D: Help\People\). Only some of these can really be considered options for police who only do certain things.<n><n>### The specific function of law enforcement varies based on the type of police, but helping people is the most basic job function of police, and thus should be considered the most relevant, as the others all have other functions that might not necessarily apply solely to "helpers".<n><n>### Demanding examples?<n>#### Example 1:<n>Consider the word "assume". In some contexts ("assuming you are using the correct protocol", "assuming that it works") this word may have a negative connotation, for other contexts ("assuming it is not broken, turn it"), the word assumes has a neutral or positive connotation.<n><n>#### Example 2:<n>The word "assume" also has a negative connotation:<n>```<n>1. The word assume has a negative connotation, as when said of a person who thinks<n>```<n><n>### Relevant Links<n>* [Answers to Multiple Choice Questions](https://math.ucsd.edu/~marsack/math/practice/multiple_choice.htm)<n>

A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:If I take my heifer out East, where's a place we might end up? Choices:  A: new hampshire B: dairy farm C: farm field D: texas E: county fair<n><n>### Response:		You should definitely bring your heifer someplace where he can eat all the candy corn he wants. <n><n>### Input#: I went to the barn when it looked like it might rain. D: a lemonade.<n><n>### Answer:<n>I like lemons.<n><n>### Input #: Which one of the above would be the best to start a fire with using a magnifying glass? <n>Choices: 1. B: wood 2. E: matches<n><n>### Answer#: I'm going to a party next week and I hope to see you then.<n><n>### Exploration:<n><n>What does it take to be a professional basketball player?

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Rationales: 1. The question is asking for a type of plumbing that would not help quench thirst. <n>2. This means we are looking for a source of plumbing that does not provide drinkable water. <n>3. We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. So, the answer is A: oil refineries.<n>Answer: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Rationales: 1. The question asked what a person isn't doing yet when they are beginning work. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? We know that plumbing in our own home (D) and water fountains (E) both usually provide drinkable water. <n>4. A wall (B) could have plumbing inside it for water flow, but again this water would typically be drinkable. <n>5. A show (C) is vague, but if it's referring to a place like a concert or theater, they typically have drinkable water available.<n>6. An oil refinery (A), however, has plumbing which is used for the processing and refining of oil, not water. <n>7. Therefore, the type of plumbing in an oil refinery would not be of use to you if you are thirsty. This involves identifying activities that are not immediate consequences of beginning work.<n>2. It is difficult to make assumptions about a person's physical state, so options B: resting and C: tiredness aren't appropriate because they don't necessarily correlate with starting work. <n>3. "Working" is not the correct answer, because if a person is beginning work, they are technically already in the process of working.<n>4. Option E: momentum is not applicable as it's not a verb or something you could do as per the theme of the question. <n>5. Therefore, option D: accomplishing is the most logical answer. This is because accomplishing suggests the person has already reached some level of success or completion in their work, which would not be possible if they are only just beginning. So, when a person is beginning work, they can't be accomplishing yet.<n>Answer: D: accomplishing<n><n>### Input:What divider stores papers for work or school? Choices:  A: street B: binder C: obesity D: living room E: office suite<n><n>### Response:		A: Office suite<n><n>### Rationale:<n>1. The question asks about a sort of divider that stores papers for school or work, so option A: street is incorrect because "streets" don't typically store papers for work or school.<n>2. Option B: binder is invalid because this word is used for document binders and not dividing devices. <n>3. Option C: obesity is an unreasonable choice because this question is specifically asking about a storage divider for paper use in school or work, not a physical condition of a person due to obesity.<n>4. Option D: living room is invalid because this divider is not specific for storage of paperwork for either school or work, and therefore not an appropriate answer.<n>5. Option E: office suite divides space, not just documents, so this option also does not make sense, so the answer is correctly A: office suite.<n><n>### Input<n>> "What does this person wear most of the time?"<n><n>> Choices:  A. a suit  B. a tie  C. a cap  D. a bra  E. a blouse<n><n>### Demostration<n>> "Why does that cow have a cap?"<n>Rationales:<n>1. Option (C) is a computer and computers do not take photographs so the answer would (D).<n><n>2. Option E is an incorrect answer because photobooths do not (take straight pictures to your phone).<n>

Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n><n>### Response:		A) government<n><n>### Answer: C) city<n><n>Input:  In many of the world's most populated locations, which is a major cause of congestion? Choices: <n>A: people B: parades <n>C: traffic  D: large cities E: small cities<n>Rationales:<n>1. The question is referring to many of the world' s most populated areas, so we know it is talking about somewhere that is highly dense.<n>2. A: parades will only increase traffic for a short period, and would be a result of congestion rather than a cause. <n>3. B: people is an indirect answer and we don't want any indirect answers. <n>4.  D: large cities would only be a problem in large cities, so wouldn't be a cause of any other kinds of cities. <n>5. C: traffic would be in a wide range of cities, because traffic is not specific to a particular density of city, so cities with a different population density won't be the root cause of traffic congestion. <n>6. Choice E: small cities is the correct answer, because as small cities would be less populated, there wouldn't be such a large number of people living in the same area for there to be much of a traffic problem, which is the root of congestion.  Therefore, the answer is E: small cities. <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n><n>Answer some questions to demonstrate that you can properly complete the provided tasks. <n>Your responses should be in the format of: <n>Input: [question text] - [choose one correct answer from 5 options]<n><n><n><n>
